transcript:
[Anonymous]: Hi how to signup 
[AI Bot]: To sign up on Revibe as a customer, simply visit our website and click on the account or sign-up icon to create your account.

If you want to become a seller, you can register easily by visiting our Become a Seller page: [Register as a Seller](https://revibe.me/pages/become-a-seller?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website).

Would you like more details on signing up as a customer or a seller?

[Support Agent]: It seems this conversation has been inactive for a while, so I'll go ahead and close it. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out again anytime!

TICKET ID: 839010
-------------------------------------------

[Anonymous]: Your Company said delivery only take 3 days now 3 days finish 

[AI Bot]: I'm sorry for the inconvenience caused by the delay. At Revibe, we deliver over 90% of orders within 1–3 business days, but sometimes unexpected delays can happen due to factors outside our control. Rest assured, our team is working to get your order to you as soon as possible. 

You can always access to the latest status of your order from My Account: [My Account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

For more details, you can also check our delivery policy [here](https://help.revibe.me/en-US/what-if-my-order-doesnt-arrive-within-3-business-days-352740?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website). If you need an update on a specific order, please provide your order number and email address.

[Anonymous]: arjunkunnath007@gmail.com

[AI Bot]: Could you please provide your order number as well? I need both your email address and order number to check the latest status of your order. 

You can always access to the latest status of your order from My Account: [My Account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

[Anonymous]: arjunkunnath007@gmail.com and 74826

[AI Bot]: Your order for the iPhone 13 Mini (Order 74826) is currently at the quality check stage. This means it hasn't shipped yet. I understand the delay is frustrating, and I appreciate your patience.

You can always access to the latest status of your order from My Account: [My Account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

[Support Agent]: (No text content)

[Support Agent]: It seems this conversation has been inactive for a while, so I'll go ahead and close it. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out again anytime!
Reason: Order delivery delay caused customer frustration.

transcript: [Anonymous]: I have opened a claim, this morning i recieved a email its closed due to lack of response i would like to continue with the claim how do i proceed? [AI Bot]: If your claim was closed due to lack of response, you can simply raise a new claim through your Revibe account. Log in, go to the "Raise a Claim" section, and submit your request again with all the required details and documents. You can always access the latest status of your claim from My Account: [My Account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website) For step-by-step guidance, check this article: [How to raise a claim](https://help.revibe.me/en-US/how-to-raise-a-claim-2269153?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website) [Anonymous]: It doesnt give me the option to opene a new claim its say: claim already exist, no option to continue of submit new claim [AI Bot]: Thank you for letting me know. If the system says "claim already exists" and does not allow you to submit a new claim or continue, you will need further assistance to resolve this issue. If you need to talk to an agent, please send an email to contact@revibe.me or call us on +971 4 459 7000. [Support Agent]: It seems this conversation has been inactive for a while, so I'll go ahead and close it. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out again anytime!
Reason: Unable to reopen claim due to system error.

transcript:
TICKET ID: 839232
-------------------------------------------

[Anonymous]: what is the meaning of at quality check

[AI Bot]: “At quality check” means the device is currently being inspected and tested by our expert technicians to ensure it meets our strict standards before it is shipped to you. This process includes checking the battery, camera, connectivity, and overall functionality. If you have a specific order or claim in this status, let me know if you’d like more details!

[Support Agent]: (No text content)

[Anonymous]: what is the meaing of raise a claim 

[AI Bot]: To "raise a claim" means to submit a request to Revibe for help with an issue related to your order, such as a warranty problem, a return, or if you haven't received your device. You can do this by logging in to your account and filling out the claim form. For step-by-step instructions, please visit the [How to raise a claim guide](https://help.revibe.me/en-US/how-to-raise-a-claim-2269153?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website).

[Anonymous]: how many days to be shipped after at quality check

[AI Bot]: Once your device is at the quality check stage, it will be inspected and prepared for shipping. The entire process, including quality check and shipping, is usually completed within 1–3 business days. You will receive updates as soon as your order is shipped.

[Anonymous]: what is the delivery courier 

[AI Bot]: We ship using a third-party courier company. Once your order is shipped, you will receive a tracking link from our courier partner with live updates on your delivery. If you need to arrange a specific delivery time, please contact the courier company directly.

[Anonymous]: how long courrier deliver in Philippines 

[AI Bot]: Sorry, I don't have information about courier delivery times in the Philippines. If you have another question related to our services, feel free to ask!

[Anonymous]: how long deliver to Philippines 

[AI Bot]: I'm sorry, but I don't have information about delivery times to the Philippines. If you have another question related to our available regions, feel free to ask!

[Anonymous]: from what country is my phone order from?

[AI Bot]: All devices ordered from Revibe are shipped from within the UAE. We deliver anywhere in the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and South Africa. If you need more details about your specific order, please provide your order number and email address.

[Anonymous]: Order PH-1069

[AI Bot]: Could you please provide the email address used to place order PH-1069? I need both your order number and email address to check the latest status and details for you. You can always access the latest status of your order from My Account: [https://revibe.me/pages/my-account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

[Anonymous]: carmelavinton@gmail.com

[AI Bot]: Your order PH-1069 for an iPhone 11 is currently at the quality check stage. This means our team is inspecting your device before shipping. You can always access the latest status of your order from My Account: [https://revibe.me/pages/my-account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

[Anonymous]: do you deliver in the Philippines?

[AI Bot]: We currently deliver orders only to the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and South Africa. Delivery to the Philippines is not available at this time. For more details, please visit our [delivery information page](https://help.revibe.me/en-US/where-do-we-currently-deliver-352781?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website).

[Anonymous]: what should I do? I'm in the Philippines 

[AI Bot]: I'm sorry, but Revibe does not deliver to the Philippines at this time. If you placed an order with a delivery address in the Philippines, please contact us at contact@revibe.me or call +971 4 459 7000 to discuss your options.

[Anonymous]: why there's an ad about revibe.me ph

[AI Bot]: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Currently, Revibe only delivers to the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and South Africa. If you saw an ad for revibe.me in the Philippines, it may have been shown in error or due to online ad targeting settings. We apologize for any confusion. If you have further questions, please let me know!

[Support Agent]: It seems this conversation has been inactive for a while, so I'll go ahead and close it. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out again anytime!
Reason: Delivery not available to customer's country.

transcript:
TICKET ID: 839298
-------------------------------------------

[Anonymous]: Hello,

[AI Bot]: Hello! How can I assist you today?

[Anonymous]: So my dad has bought a MacBook for me, and we thought it got stolen so I had locked it through find my. The problem is, it never got stolen in the first place — the maid misplaced it. Now I wanted to give it to my mother, but the thing is I got rid of the tie to my find my thinking it would get rid of the lock, however it’s still on this screen

[AI Bot]: I understand how frustrating this situation must be. If your MacBook is still showing the lock screen from Find My, removing it from your account alone won’t unlock it. You’ll need to enter the passcode you set when you locked it through Find My. 

If you don’t remember the passcode or can’t unlock it, you may need to contact Apple Support with proof of purchase for further assistance.

Would you like some troubleshooting tips or guidance on what to do next?

[Anonymous]: I was on call w apple support and they told me to find the MDM number 

[AI Bot]: If Apple Support asked you to find the MDM (Mobile Device Management) number, they likely want to check if the MacBook is managed by an organization or school. Usually, personal MacBooks do not have MDM profiles unless set up by a company or institution.

To check for MDM on your MacBook:

1. On the lock screen, look for any message mentioning "This Mac is managed" or similar.
2. If you can log in, go to  > System Settings > Profiles. If there’s an MDM profile, it will be listed there.

If you’re still locked out and can’t access the settings, you may need to provide Apple with the serial number (found on the MacBook’s underside or box) instead.

Would you like more detailed steps or help with something else?

[Anonymous]: its unfortunately LOCKED still 

[AI Bot]: I’m sorry you’re still locked out. If the MacBook is stuck on the lock screen and you can’t access the settings, you won’t be able to check for MDM directly. In this case, provide Apple Support with the MacBook’s serial number (found on the bottom of the device or on the box). They can use this to check the device’s status and guide you further.

If you need more help or have questions about your MacBook, let me know!

[Anonymous]: How do

[AI Bot]: It looks like your message got cut off. Could you please let me know what you’d like to ask or how I can assist you further?

[Anonymous]: I find out the serial number 

[AI Bot]: You can find your MacBook’s serial number in these ways:

- On the bottom of your MacBook (engraved in small print).
- On the original box or purchase receipt.

Let me know if you need more help!

[Support Agent]: (No text content)

[Anonymous]: The purchase receipt doesn’t say anything 

[AI Bot]: If the purchase receipt doesn’t show the serial number, please check the bottom of your MacBook. The serial number is usually engraved in small print near the regulatory markings. If you still have the original box, it should also be printed on a sticker there.

If you need more help, let me know!

[Anonymous]: Can I call a real person from here

[AI Bot]: If you need to talk to an agent, please send an email to contact@revibe.me or call us on +971 4 459 7000.

[Anonymous]: I’m in saydi tho

[AI Bot]: If you are in Saudi Arabia, you can still email contact@revibe.me for support, or you can use the UAE phone number: +971 4 459 7000. Currently, there is no separate phone number for Saudi Arabia, but our team will assist you via email or the provided phone number.

[Anonymous]: They’re cutting the call

[AI Bot]: I'm sorry you're having trouble reaching us by phone. Please try sending an email to contact@revibe.me with your details and the issue—our team will respond as soon as possible. If you need more guidance, let me know!

[Anonymous]: It’s been

[AI Bot]: It seems your message was cut off. Could you please resend your full question or let me know how I can assist you further?

[Anonymous]: Shipped from dubai

[AI Bot]: Thank you for sharing that your MacBook was shipped from Dubai. If you have any questions about your order status, delivery, or need further assistance, please provide your order number and the email used for the purchase. I’ll be happy to help you check the latest status.

You can always access to the latest status of your order from My Account: [My Account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

[Anonymous]: But im in Saudi 

[AI Bot]: No problem! We deliver to Saudi Arabia as well. If your order was shipped from Dubai and you are in Saudi, delivery may take a bit longer due to international shipping. If you’d like to check your order status, please provide your order number and email.

You can always access to the latest status of your order from My Account: [My Account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

[Anonymous]: no the thing is my MacBook was sent to me from Dubai to Saudi and it already had a password, but I don’t know it anymore because it’s locked. I have invoice and and receipts but I need the number and the serial number, how do I get it is there anyway I can ask one of the employees to look into the database and give it to me

[AI Bot]: I understand your situation and how frustrating it must be. Unfortunately, I don’t have access to customer databases or the ability to retrieve serial numbers or order details for you. For privacy and security, only our support team can assist with such requests.

Please email contact@revibe.me with your order details (such as your name, email, and any information from your invoice or receipt). Our team will verify your purchase and help you retrieve your serial number or any other needed information.

If you need to check your order status or details, you can also log in to your account here: [My Account](https://revibe.me/pages/my-account?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website)

[Support Agent]: It seems this conversation has been inactive for a while, so I'll go ahead and close it. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out again anytime!
Reason: Customer frustrated with locked device and difficulty getting serial number.

transcript:
[Anonymous]: Hello
[AI Bot]: Hello! How can I assist you today?
[Anonymous]: I have an issue with my phone
[AI Bot]: I'm sorry to hear you're having an issue with your phone. Could you please describe the problem in more detail? This will help me guide you on the best next steps.
[Anonymous]: The iPhone has shut down. It had 90% battery. It doesn’t start again.
[AI Bot]: Thank you for sharing the details. I understand how frustrating this must be. Please try the following steps:
- Force restart your iPhone by pressing and quickly releasing the Volume Up button, then the Volume Down button, and then press and hold the Side button until you see the Apple logo.
- If it still doesn't turn on, try charging your device with a different cable and adapter for at least 30 minutes.
If the issue persists, please let me know, and I can guide you on the next steps.
[Anonymous]: The issue persists
[AI Bot]: Thank you for trying those steps. Since your iPhone still won't turn on, I recommend submitting a warranty claim. Please take a clear video or picture showing the issue (for example, trying to turn on the device and nothing happening). This evidence will help with the claim process.
Would you like guidance on how to start a warranty claim?
[Anonymous]: Yes
[AI Bot]: To start a warranty claim, please visit the warranty and returns form on our website: [Raise a claim](https://revibe.me/pages/warranty-and-returns-form?utm_source=gleen&utm_medium=website).
Make sure to upload a clear video or picture showing the issue—such as attempting to power on the device and it not responding. This will help our team process your claim quickly.
If you need more help with the process, let me know!
[Support Agent]: (No text content)
[Support Agent]: It seems this conversation has been inactive for a while, so I'll go ahead and close it. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out again anytime!
Reason: iPhone shut down, won't restart, issue persists.
